abstract: Some institutions quietly and creatively charge people more to save and spend their own money.
snippet: Some institutions quietly and creatively charge people more to save and spend their own money.
lead_paragraph: Bounced check: $32. Stop-payment: $30. A.T.M. charge: as high as $3.

headline.main: Bank Fees Rise as Lenders Try to Offset Losses

abstract: A group of five public pension funds, including state funds in Ohio and Texas, have won the right to lead investor class-action lawsuits against the Bank of America over its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.
snippet: A group of five public pension funds, including state funds in Ohio and Texas, have won the right to lead investor class-action lawsuits against the Bank of America over its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.
lead_paragraph: A group of five public pension funds, including state funds in Ohio and Texas, have won the right to lead investor class-action lawsuits against the Bank of America over its acquisition of Merrill Lynch.

headline.main: Pension Funds to Lead Suit Against Bank

abstract: Having lowered its main refinancing rate to 1 percent, the bank appears to have adopted a wait-and-see approach to additional stimulus.
snippet: Having lowered its main refinancing rate to 1 percent, the bank appears to have adopted a wait-and-see approach to additional stimulus.
lead_paragraph: PARIS  The European Central Bank left its main interest rate steady for the second consecutive month on Thursday, appearing to adopt a wait-and-see approach to additional stimulus.

headline.main: Europe’s Central Bank Holds Rate Steady
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Central Bank Holds Rate Steady
